greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Cube excess of the n-th prime.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = prime(n) - floor(prime(n)^(1/3))^3. - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Jan 17 2015
example: a(48) = 7 because the 48th prime is 223 and 223 - 6^3 = 7, while 223 - 7^3 = -120.
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Mar 10 2005
